structure.unit: PUBLIC PRINTING AND DISTRIBUTION OF PUBLIC DOCUMENTS

law.catch_line: Custody and care of public books.
law.text: Any public officer, except a member of the General Assembly, who receives any books from the state shall hold them as public property and as an appendage to his office, and deliver them to his successor. Each officer shall take good care of the books delivered to him.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 2423, 2424.
